intro: Syngonanthus gracilis var. griseus, commonly known as the gray leaved slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, grayish-green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for wetland ecosystems.
